issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Pipe mapreduce job fails with Permission denied for jobTokenPassword

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body:
Uploaded the 1st patch. 

Since {{Application.java}} makes a {{jobTokenPassword}} under the current directory, it is generated under the root directory of hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient module when {{TestPipeApplication}} runs. The patch fixes the path.

I think MAPREDUCE-7036.1.patch would work fine for the license issue.
I reran Jenkins since MAPREDUCE-7041 is resolved now.

This message was automatically generated.
The failed test is not related to the 1st patch.
LGTM, +1
This fixes not only test code but also production code, so changing the issue type to bug.
Committed this to trunk. Thank you, [~tasanuma0829]!

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #13576 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/13576/])
MAPREDUCE-7036. ASF License warning in hadoop-mapreduce-client (aajisaka: rev 56feaa40bb94fcaa96ae668eebfabec4611928c0)
* (edit) hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/pipes/Application.java
* (edit) hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/pipes/TestPipeApplication.java
Thank you very much, [~ajisakaa]!

[~tasanuma0829] [~ajisakaa] Reopening this issue since this patch breaks MapReduce Pipes and causes a race condition due to maps and reducers writing to the same directory in MAPREDUCE-7077. The title of this patch is misleading since it mentions fix of License but makes code changes instead. Can you edit Jira summary to reflect the exact changes done ?

Thanks [~suma.shivaprasad] and offline help from [~vinodkv] to figure out the root case. 

I suggest to revert this patch, such ASF license warning does not exist in Hadoop code, which is accidentally introduced by yetus, I think the fix should be landed in yetus.

Thoughts? [~ajisakaa] / [~tasanuma0829]
Just realized reopening this doesn't make sense since 3.1.0 is already released. We should keep this ticket fixed and open a new JIRA.
Thanks [~vinodkv] [~leftnoteasy] A new Jira has been filed here - MAPREDUCE-7077
Sorry for breaking MapReduce Pipes. I'm +1 for reverting this in MAPREDUCE-7077

bq. We should keep this ticket fixed and open a new JIRA.
Okay, fixed.
Sorry for creating the bug, and thanks for catching it.
Thanks [~tasanuma0829] / [~ajisakaa].
